translations.Your client is not authorized to connect: Your client is not authorised to connect. Please inform the administrator of your client.
translations.Your client is expired. Please inform th: Your client has expired. Please inform the administrator of your client.
translations.The received redirect URI is not accepte: The received redirect URI is not accepted to connect. Please inform the administrator of your client.
translations.The user is not a member of the groups d: The user is not a member of the groups defined for the client. You are not allowed to retrieve a login token.
translations.A failure during JWT creation occured. P: A failure during JWT creation occured. Please inform the administrator of your client.
translations.Your redirect URL needs to be a full URL: Your redirect URL needs to be a full URL for example: https://yourdomain.com/path
translations.Your client ID must comply with the foll: Your client ID must comply with the following rules: chars A-Za-z0-9 & min length 32 & max length 64
translations.Your client secret must comply with the: Your client secret must comply with the following rules: chars A-Za-z0-9 & min length 32 & max length 64
translations.Nextcloud as OpenID Connect Identity Pro: Nextcloud as OpenID Connect Identity Provider

Nextcloud as OpenID Connect Identity Provider

With this app you can use Nextcloud as OpenID Connect Identity Provider. If other services
are configured correctly, you are able to access those services with your Nextcloud login.

Full documentation can be found at:

- [User Documentation](https://github.com/H2CK/oidc/wiki#user-documentation)
- [Developer Documentation](https://github.com/H2CK/oidc/wiki#developer-documentation)
translations.OpenID Connect allows to authenticate at: OpenID Connect allows to authenticate at external services with {instanceName} user accounts.
translations.Name: Surname
translations.Enable or disable Dynamic Client Registr: Enable or disable Dynamic Client Registration

translations.Select default token type for new client: Select default token type for new clients

translations.Define if user can make own user specifi: Define if user can make own user specific changes to settings
translations.Select if user is able to modify user sp: Select if user is able to modify user specific settings
translations.OIDC-compliant clients must request the: OIDC-compliant clients must request the offline_access scope to receive refresh tokens. Enable legacy mode only if you have non-compliant clients that cannot be updated.
translations.Removed information from ID token and us: Removed information from ID token and userinfo endpoint
translations.OpenID Connect allows you to log in to e: OpenID Connect allows you to log in to external services with your {instanceName} user account.

translations.{clientName} is requesting access to you: {clientName} is requesting access to your account.
translations.This application will be able to:: This application will be able to:
translations.You can revoke this access at any time f: You can revoke this access at any time from your account settings.
translations.Are you sure you want to revoke access f: Are you sure you want to revoke access for "{clientName}"?
translations.These applications have access to your a: These applications have access to your account. Access is managed by your administrator.
These applications have access to your account. You can revoke access at any time.
translations.Flows allowed to be used with the client: Flows allowed to be used with the client.
translations.Only users in one of the following group: Only users in one of the following groups are allowed to use the client.
Groups allowed to use the client.
translations.Define the allowed scopes for the client: Define the allowed scopes for the client separated by a whitespace, e.g. openid profile roles. Do not enter any value to allow all scopes.
translations.Usually the primary email address is use: Usually the primary email address is used during OpenID control flows. If you wish to use other email adresses (defined as secondary email address in personal settings) you could define a regular expression for selecting the used email address. E.g. .*@domain.tld
translations.Resource URL (RFC 9728) for token intros: Resource URL (RFC 9728) for token introspection authorisation. Clients with this URL can introspect tokens issued to this resource.
